content.prompt: Which of the following best describes how the structure of the passage affects its pacing?

choices.label: The narrator tells the story by means of a series of flashbacks, briefly hinting at the significance of each episode for different characters.
The narrator relates events chronologically but briefly interrupts the narrative with a digression.
The narrator anticipates the conclusion of the passage by foreshadowing the fate of each character.
The narrator begins without providing background information and concludes by describing the characters and the circumstances.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Identify and describe how plot orders events in a narrative.
